wikipedia_page.main: John Bashford was a British sports shooter. He competed in three events at the 1908 Summer Olympics. In the Men's Free Pistol, 50 yards event, he scored 329 points.

link_mentions.page: Shooting at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's 50 yard pistol
Shooting at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's single-shot running deer
response: De Wael also lists another British shooter, John Bashford, as having competed and placed lower than Barbillat.  However, the Official Report makes no mention of Bashford in its list of competitors.
